divs: Sighting DetailsSitting on the back deck watching the night sky. The object originated from Mizar, the second star in the handle of the Big Dipper. Initially appeared like a white-light pinhole that expanded to a flat line - like a dash. It moved from East to West across the night sky, expanding in length as it traveled then contracting to another pin-sized white dot - landing on a neighboring star. This was not a meteor. This behaved very differently.
Summary: The object appeared to originate from Mizar - the middle star on the handle of the Big Dipper, moving Westward to another star.
trends: There have been 7 other sightings in Waukegan
There were no other sightings in Waukegan on or around February 27th 2012
